episodeTitle: Nami's Decision! Fire at the Out-of-Control Chopper!
episodeTitleJapanese: ナミの決断！暴走チョッパーを撃て！
episodeTitleRomanized: Nami no ketsudan! Bōsō Choppā o ute!
description: Nami defeats Kalifa in a climactic battle using her Thunder Lance Tempo technique. Meanwhile, Chopper's uncontrollable Monster Point rampage threatens the crew, forcing Franky to blast him into the sea to restore him to normal. After retrieving Kalifa's key, Nami frees Zoro and Sogeking from their Sea Prism Stone handcuffs, allowing them to continue their respective battles.

events.title: Nami Unveils Mirage Tempo: Fata Morgana
events.description: Nami uses the advanced Mirage Tempo: Fata Morgana technique for the first time against Kalifa. This creates five different illusions of Nami using temperature differentials and light refraction - a tall skinny version, a short child version, a fat version, a muscular version, and a normal version. Only one is real, and each can replicate her attacks, creating confusion for opponents.
events.significance: This demonstrates a significant evolution in Nami's combat abilities with the Perfect Clima-Tact, showing her growing mastery of weather-based illusions and tactics. The technique proves crucial in her victory against the CP9 member.

quotes.text: Which one is the real me? You'll never know!
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Taunting Kalifa while surrounded by her mirror images

events.title: Kalifa's Hitsuji Gumo Tidal Wave
events.description: Kalifa sweeps the entire bathroom with a tidal wave of her power-draining soap bubbles in an attempt to counter all five of Nami's illusions simultaneously. The bubbles drain strength from anyone they touch and leave them smooth and slippery, making it nearly impossible to fight.
events.significance: This reveals the full extent of Kalifa's Awa Awa no Mi abilities, showing she can create massive waves of bubbles to affect an entire room. It demonstrates why she's a formidable CP9 agent despite her relative inexperience with the Devil Fruit.

quotes.text: I'll wash away all your illusions at once!
quotes.speaker: Kalifa

events.title: Thunder Lance Tempo Defeats Kalifa
events.description: Nami unleashes Thunder Lance Tempo, sending a devastating horizontal lightning bolt directly from the dark clouds she created earlier through her Perfect Clima-Tact and into Kalifa. The powerful electrical attack strikes Kalifa with overwhelming force, defeating the CP9 assassin in one decisive blow.
events.significance: This marks Nami's first solo victory against a powerful enemy combatant in the New World caliber. The Thunder Lance Tempo becomes one of Nami's signature finishing moves, representing her evolution from a non-combatant navigator to a capable fighter who can defeat elite government agents.

quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Delivering her finishing blow to Kalifa

events.title: Nami Defeats Kalifa
events.description: Kalifa collapses unconscious after being struck by Nami's Thunder Lance Tempo, marking the end of their intense battle. Nami stands victorious but exhausted, having overcome both Kalifa's CP9 combat training and her Devil Fruit powers through clever tactics and determination.
events.significance: This is a watershed moment for Nami's character development as a fighter. It's her first major solo victory against a serious opponent who was actively trying to kill her, proving she can hold her own against elite government assassins. The victory also secures one of the keys needed to free Robin.

quotes.text: I won't let anyone hurt my friends!
quotes.speaker: Nami

events.title: Franky Decides to Blast Chopper into the Sea
events.description: Witnessing Monster Point Chopper's uncontrollable rampage threatening both allies and enemies alike in the Tower of Justice, Franky makes the difficult decision to use his Coup de Vent to blast Chopper through the wall and into the sea below. This risky move is the only way to force Chopper back to normal by exploiting his Devil Fruit weakness.
events.significance: This demonstrates Franky's quick thinking and willingness to make tough calls to protect the crew, even if it means potentially harming a crewmate in the short term. It shows his understanding of Devil Fruit mechanics and his growing bond with the Straw Hats.

quotes.text: Sorry, little guy, but this is for your own good!
quotes.speaker: Franky
quotes.context: Before blasting Chopper with Coup de Vent

events.title: Franky Uses Coup de Vent on Chopper
events.description: Franky connects both of his cyborg arms together with a T-shaped pipe, sucks massive amounts of air into his abnormally large arms, and fires a blast of compressed air at supersonic speed. The wind cannon hits Monster Point Chopper with tremendous force, launching him through the tower wall and into the sea below.
events.significance: This is the first time Coup de Vent is used in a rescue capacity rather than pure offense. The technique demonstrates Franky's versatility and his arsenal of powerful air-based attacks. The move successfully saves Chopper from the dangers of prolonged Monster Point.

events.title: Franky Dives After Chopper
events.description: Immediately after blasting Chopper into the sea, Franky dives out of the Tower of Justice and into the ocean after him to ensure his rescue. Despite not being a Devil Fruit user himself, Franky risks the dangerous fall and swim to save the small reindeer doctor from drowning.
events.significance: This selfless act demonstrates Franky's heroic nature and his commitment to protecting the Straw Hat crew, foreshadowing his eventual joining of the crew. It shows he's willing to risk his own life for his new friends.

quotes.text: Hang on, Chopper! I'm coming for ya!
quotes.speaker: Franky
quotes.context: Diving after Chopper into the sea

events.title: Chopper Returns to Normal Form
events.description: Upon hitting the seawater, the Monster Point transformation immediately ends and Chopper reverts to his normal small form. The seawater's effect on Devil Fruit users neutralizes the three Rumble Ball transformation, saving Chopper from the life-threatening strain of the extended Monster Point.
events.significance: This confirms that seawater can be used strategically to counter dangerous Devil Fruit transformations. It also saves Chopper's life, as prolonged Monster Point usage would have killed him. The event shows the vulnerability but also the utility of Devil Fruit weaknesses.

events.title: Nami Retrieves Kalifa's Key
events.description: After defeating Kalifa, Nami searches the unconscious CP9 agent and retrieves the key she was carrying. This key is essential for freeing prisoners and unlocking the Sea Prism Stone handcuffs that are binding various members of the rescue team.
events.significance: Securing this key is crucial to the success of the Enies Lobby raid. It allows the Straw Hats to free their restrained members and continue their assault to rescue Robin. The key retrieval shows Nami's tactical thinking even in the aftermath of an exhausting battle.

events.title: Zoro and Sogeking Freed from Handcuffs
events.description: Nami uses Kalifa's key to unlock the Sea Prism Stone handcuffs that have been binding Zoro and Sogeking together since they accidentally handcuffed themselves. The two warriors are finally free to fight independently against their respective CP9 opponents, Kaku and Jabra.
events.significance: This moment is pivotal for the Enies Lobby battle. Zoro and Usopp had been severely handicapped fighting while chained together. Their freedom allows them to fight at full strength against two of CP9's strongest members. The comedic predicament of their handcuffing finally comes to an end.

quotes.text: Finally! Now I can fight properly!
quotes.speaker: Zoro

quotes.text: Thank goodness! I never want to be chained to you again!
quotes.speaker: Sogeking
quotes.context: Relief at being separated from Zoro

quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Delivering the finishing blow to Kalifa

quotes.text: Sorry, little guy, but this is for your own good!
quotes.speaker: Franky
quotes.context: Before blasting Chopper with Coup de Vent

quotes.text: Finally! Now I can fight properly!
quotes.speaker: Zoro

themes.description: Nami demonstrates tremendous growth as a combatant, overcoming a trained CP9 assassin with Devil Fruit powers through ingenuity, tactics, and determination rather than pure strength.
themes.symbolism: The lightning bolt represents Nami's inner strength emerging when her friends need her most.

themes.description: Franky makes difficult decisions to protect the crew, willing to hurt Chopper in the short term to save his life in the long term, and risking himself by diving into the sea after him.
themes.symbolism: The act of diving after Chopper into dangerous waters symbolizes Franky's growing bond with the Straw Hats.

themes.description: The episode emphasizes intelligence and tactical planning as Nami uses environmental conditions, illusions, and patience to overcome a physically superior opponent.
themes.symbolism: The Fata Morgana technique represents how perception and clever misdirection can overcome raw power.
culturalReferences: Fata Morgana is named after the atmospheric optical phenomenon

characterSpotlights.development: Nami proves herself as a capable combatant who can defeat elite government assassins. Her victory over Kalifa marks her evolution from support character to a fighter who can hold her own in serious battles.
keyActions: Uses Mirage Tempo: Fata Morgana to create illusions
Survives Kalifa's bubble tidal wave
Defeats Kalifa with Thunder Lance Tempo
Retrieves the key from Kalifa
Frees Zoro and Sogeking from handcuffs
quotes: I won't let anyone hurt my friends!

characterSpotlights.development: Despite her formidable Devil Fruit powers and CP9 training, Kalifa's arrogance and underestimation of Nami leads to her defeat. Her loss demonstrates that skill and determination can overcome raw power.
keyActions: Uses Hitsuji Gumo tidal wave attack
Attempts to counter Nami's illusions
Is defeated by Thunder Lance Tempo
Loses consciousness and her key
quotes: I'll wash away all your illusions at once!

characterSpotlights.development: Franky demonstrates his value to the crew by making tough tactical decisions and risking himself to save Chopper. His actions foreshadow his eventual joining of the Straw Hat Pirates.
keyActions: Recognizes the danger of Monster Point Chopper
Blasts Chopper into the sea with Coup de Vent
Dives after Chopper to rescue him from drowning
quotes: Sorry, little guy, but this is for your own good!
Hang on, Chopper! I'm coming for ya!

characterSpotlights.development: Chopper's Monster Point proves to be both incredibly powerful and dangerously uncontrollable, nearly killing him before Franky's intervention saves his life.
keyActions: Rampages in Monster Point form
Is blasted into the sea by Franky
Returns to normal form upon hitting the water
Is rescued by Franky

characterSpotlights.development: After enduring the humiliation of being handcuffed to Usopp, Zoro is finally freed and can fight at full strength against Kaku.
keyActions: Fights while handcuffed to Sogeking
Is freed by Nami using Kalifa's key
Prepares to face Kaku in single combat
quotes: Finally! Now I can fight properly!

characterSpotlights.development: As Sogeking, Usopp experiences relief at being freed from the handcuffs, allowing him to support the crew more effectively.
keyActions: Fights while handcuffed to Zoro
Is freed by Nami
Expresses relief at separation from Zoro
quotes: Thank goodness! I never want to be chained to you again!

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends the battle between Nami and Kalifa with additional action sequences and dialogue not present in the manga.
The anime shows more of Franky's pursuit of Chopper and his Coup de Vent attack in greater detail.

trivia.fact: Thunder Lance Tempo becomes one of Nami's signature finishing moves throughout the rest of the series, used in many important battles.
This is Nami's first major solo victory against a serious combatant of CP9 caliber, marking a significant milestone in her development as a fighter.

sources.title: Nami vs. Kalifa - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: Fata Morgana is named after the real atmospheric optical phenomenon that creates complex mirror images in the air, often seen over large bodies of water.
Coup de Vent is French for 'gust of wind,' fitting Franky's tendency to use French names for his attacks.

sources.title: Franky/Abilities and Powers - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: The episode has an IMDB rating of 8.0/10, indicating positive reception from viewers.
This episode adapts portions of manga chapters 411 and 412, with chapter 411 titled 'Nami vs Kalifa' and chapter 412 titled 'You Missed Your Chance.'
